page.title: 09One City Primary School
page.content:
{The Beeches School}opened in 1983 following the amalgamation of an infant and a junior school. The school has a roll of 450 pupils with 49 adults working in a variety of ways. Almost 90% of the pupils are of Pakistani origin _ mainly from the Mirpur region of Pakistan.
The school serves an area with a rich cultural mix which includes Pakistani muslims, Indians _ both Sikh and Hindu Afro-Carribean families, Italians, Vietnamese and English. The area reflects this mix in its places of worship and its shops.
The local community makes use of the school premises in a variety of ways and the children in the school use the community and local environment in their studies.
